Question 33 
 
[Irrigation Engineering : Water Requirements of Crops]
 
 
A canal supplies water to an area growing wheat over 100 hectares. The duration between the first and 
last watering is 120 days, and the total depth of water required by the crop is 35 cm. The most intense 
watering is required over a period of 30 days and requires a total depth of water equal to 12 cm. 
Assuming precipitation to be negligible and neglecting all losses, the minimum discharge (in m
3
/s,
